items.title: Basketball, The Natural Prediction
items.text: For this project, me and my team thought ”if nature choose the natual selection to evolve things, why shouldn't we?” So we built a natural selection in python from scratch, without any librarys of IA, to help us predict the result of games using data from past games.

items.title: WikiSpeed, The daily game of links
items.text: In this game you start in a wikipedia page and you have to get in another specified page just through the links. You can play this game by clicking here

items.title: Netflix, the return of the clone
items.text: For this project, I wanted to pratice my CSS, so I choose a site that most of people know the style and tried to copy it design.

items.title: Cubik, minimalistic rubiks cube timer
items.text: Most of online timers are full of stuff and have a heavy design, the idea here was just to create a clean one.

items.title: Joelho-e-o-Pe-de-Feijao, The game
items.text: This is a 2D platform game made in C# on Unity that was developed as a school project together with a friend. The idea was to make a simple game but with a focus in character movement and others controls

items.title: Lince, The growing local company
items.text: Lince was responsible for make the tecnology for the two biggest factories of my city, and I used a mix of Java, Javascript, and CSS inside another language called xseed that is like a cobol to java migration language. I stayed 6 months there, and left to focus in React.

items.title: SCI - Sistemas contábeis
items.text: SCI is a company that makes accounting systems for people and for others companies, I worked making maintence in the system with them for 1 year. I used Delphi, but was not my favorite stack. But it was a great experience.

items.title: Edition
items.text: Editing, both video and images, is one of my hobbies for the last 8 years, and I learned a lot in this time. in the matter of technology, I have experience with Sony Vegas and Davince Resolve for videos, and Photoshop and Illustrator for images.

items.title: Maybe its just that
items.text: I thought that I would have more to say. Sorry for creating a new session just for that.
